poem:
### Pasvik Awakening

In the snowy cradle of Pasvik,  
teens shed the digital skins,  
silent echoes from speckled screens.  
Fingers trace ancient paths,  
learning the whispers of wind,  
the language of leaves,  
where pixelated pressures fade  
and stone age hearts  
beat warmly beneath  
the icy blanket  
of northern skies.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative.
